Modules

blimputils - A Python library for the Falcon Flight controller board.

blimputils.init(i2c_bus: int = 1, accel_addr: int | None = 104, gyro_addr: int | None = 104, mag_addr: int | None = 20, motor_pins_config: Dict[str, Dict[str, int | None]] | None = None) → Tuple[Accelerometer | None, Gyroscope | None, magnetometer_bmm350 | None, Dict[str, Motor]]

Initializes the sensors and motors.

Parameters:

  • i2c_bus – The I2C bus number for sensors.

  • accel_addr – I2C address for the accelerometer. If None, accelerometer is not initialized.

  • gyro_addr – I2C address for the gyroscope. If None, gyroscope is not initialized.

  • mag_addr – I2C address for the magnetometer. If None, magnetometer is not initialized.

  • motor_pins_config – Configuration for motor pins. Example: {“motor1”: {“pin1”: 17, “pin2”: 18, “pwm_pin”: None}} If None, uses DEFAULT_MOTOR_PINS.

Returns:

A tuple containing the initialized (or None) sensor instances and a dictionary of motor instances.

Raises:

IOError – If sensor initialization fails.

blimputils.cleanup()

Cleans up resources used by sensors and motors.

API Reference:

  • blimputils.accelerometer
